intro: Coccoloba fluviatilis, commonly known as river beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically found in wetland and riparian habitats. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found near rivers and streams. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for water gardens and wetland restoration projects.
